2111910.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111910
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 001
2111910.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to us, "O young men, those of you who can support a wife should marry, for it (marriage) controls the gaze and preserves one from immorality. And whoever cannot (marry) should fast, for it is a means of reducing the sexual desire." [Agreed upon].

2111920.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111920
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 002
2111920.text: Narrated Anas bin Malik (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) praised Allah, extolled Him and said, "Yet I pray and sleep; I fast and break my fast; and I marry women. He who is displeased with my Sunnah (practices) is not my followed." [Agreed upon].

2111930.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111930
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 003
2111930.text: Narrated [Anas bin Malik (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to command us to marry and sternly forbid celibacy and say, "Marry women who are beloved (due to their good characteristics), prolific in bearing children, for I shall outnumber the Prophets by you on the Day of Resurrection." [Reported by Ahmad and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2111940.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111940
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 004
2111940.text: The aforesaid Hadith has a supporting narration reported by Abu Dawud. an-Nasa'i and Ibn Hibban from Ma'qal bin Yasar's Hadith.

2111950.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111950
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 005
2111950.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "A woman is married for four qualities, for her wealth, her family status, her beauty and her religion: so get the religious one and prosper." [Agreed upon, with the rest of the as-Sab'a].

2111960.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111960
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 006
2111960.text: Narrated [Abu Hurairah (RA)]: When the Prophet (ﷺ) congratulated a man on his marriage he would say, "Allah bless for you (your spouse), grant you blessing, and join you together in goodness." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a. at-Tirmidhi, Ibn Khuzaimah and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2111970.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111970
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 007
2111970.text: Narrared 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) taught us Tashahhud in case of some need, which is: "Praise is due to Allah, Whom we praise and from Whom we ask help and forgiveness. We seek refuge in Allah from the evils of ourselves. He whom Allah guides has no one who can lead him astray, and he whom He leads astray has no one to guide him. I testify that there is nothing deserving of worship except Allah, and I testify that Muhammad is His slave and Messenger." He (then) recites three Verses. [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a. at-Tirmidhi and al-Hakim graded it Hasan (good)].

2111980.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111980
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 008
2111980.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When one of you proposes (marriage) to a woman, if he is able to look at what will induce him to marry her, he should do so." [Reported by Ahmad and Abu Dawud. Its narrators are Thiqa (reliable) and al-Hakim declared it to be Sahih (authentic)].

2111990.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111990
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 009
2111990.text: The aforesaid Hadith has a Shahid (supporting narration) reported by at-Tirmidhi and an-Nasa'i from al-Mughirah.

2112000.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112000
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 010
2112000.text: It also has a Shahid (supporting narration) reported by Ibn Majah and Ibn Hibban from the Hadith of Muhammad bin Maslamah.

2112010.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112010
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 011
2112010.text: Muslim reported from Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) asked a man who had intended to marry a woman, "Have you looked at her" He replied, "No." He said, "Go and look at her."

2112020.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112020
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 012
2112020.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "No one of you should ask a woman in marriage when his brother has done so already, until the one who has proposed (to her) before him gives her up, or gives him permission." [Agreed upon. The wording is al-Bukhari's].

2112030.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112030
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 013
2112030.text: Narrated Sahl bin Sa'd as-Sa'idi (RA): A woman came to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and said, "O Allah's Messenger, I came to offer myself to you (in marriage)." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) looked her up and down (carefully), and then Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) lowed his head. When the woman saw that he had not made any decision regarding her she sat down. A man of his companions then stood up and said, "O Allah's Messenger, if you have no need for her, marry her to me." He asked, "Do you have anything (to give her as dowry)?" He replied, "No, I swear by Allah, O Allah's Messenger." He thereupon said, "Go to your family and see if you can find something." He went and then returned and said, "No, I swear by Allah I found nothing." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) then said, "Look for something, even if it should be an iron ring." He went and then returned and said, "No, I swear by Allah, O Allah's Messenger, not even an iron ring; but I have onl this lower garment of mine - [Sahl said, 'He had no upper garment'] - and I shall give her half of it." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) then said, "What will she do with your lower garment? For if you wear it, there would be nothing of it on her, and if she wears it, there would be nothing of it on you." The man then sat down and when he had sit for a long time he stood up and Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saw him departing, so he commanded him and he was called back. When he came back, he said, "What do you have (i.e. memorized) from the Qur'an?" He replied, "I have Surat such and such and Surat such and such," he counted them. He then asked "Can you recited them by heart?" He replied, "Yes." He said, "Go, for I have given her to you in marriage for the part of the Qur'an which you know." [Agreed upon; the wording is Muslim's]. Another narration has: "Go for I have given her to you in marriage, so teach her some of Qur'an." A narration by al-Bukhari has: "I have married her to you for the part of the Qur'an which you know."

2112180.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112180
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 014
2112180.text: Abu Dawud has a narration from Abu Hurairah (RA): He asked, "What have you memorized?" He replied, "Surat al-Baqarah and the one that follows it." He then said. "Get up and teach her twenty Verses."

2112210.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112210
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 015
2112210.text: Narrated 'Aamir bin 'Abdullah bin az-Zubair on the authority of his father: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Make marriage publicly known." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2112220.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112220
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 016
2112220.text: Narrated Abu Burda bin Abu Musa on the authority of his father; Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "There is no marriage without a guardian." [Ahmad and al-Arba'a reported it. Ibn al-Madini, at-Tirmidhi and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic), but it was regarded defective for being Mursal (missing link after the Tabi'i)].

2112230.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112230
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 017
2112230.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If anyone married without the consent of her guardian, her marriage is invalid. If there is cohabitation, she is entitled to the dowry, due to the sexual intercourse made lawful with her. If there is a dispute (between her guardian), the ruler is the guardian of one who has no guardian." [Reported by al-Arba'a except an-Nasa'i. Abu 'Awanah, Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2112240.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112240
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 018
2112240.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "A previously married woman must not be married till she is consulted, and a virgin must not be married till her consent is asked." They asked, "O Allah's Messenger, how is her consent indicated?" He replied, "It is by her silence." [Agreed upon].

2112250.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112250
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 019
2112250.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "A woman who has been previously married has more right over her person than her guardian, and a virgin must be consulted, and her consent is silence." [Reported by Muslim].

2112260.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112260
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 020
2112260.text: Another narration has: "A guardian has no authority over a woman who has been previously married,; and an orphan girl must be consulted." [Reported by Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i; Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2112270.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112270
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 021
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 021
2112270.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "A woman may not give a woman in marriage, nor may she give herself in marriage." [Reported by Ibn Majah and ad-Daraqutni. Its narrators are reliable (thiqah)].

2112280.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112280
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 022
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 022
2112280.text: Narrated Nafi' from Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) prohibited Shighar, which means that a man gives his daughter in marriage on condition that the other gives his daughter to him in marriage [in exchange] without any dowry being paid by either. [Agreed upon].

2112290.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112290
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 023
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 023
2112290.text: And they both agreed that the explanation of the meaning of Shighar is the saying of Nafi'.

2112300.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112300
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 024
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 024
2112300.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): A virgin girl came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and mentioned that her father had married her against her will, so Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) allowed her to exercise her choice. [Reported by Ahmad, Abu Dawud and Ibn Majah. If it is considered defective for being Mursal (missing link in the chain after the Tabi'i)].

2112310.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112310
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 025
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 025
2112310.text: Narrated al-Hasan from Samurah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "If two guardians have given a woman in marriage, she marries the man she was first married to." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a. at-Tirmidhi graded it Hasan (good)].

2112320.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112320
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 026
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 026
2112320.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Any slave who marries without the permission of his masters or owners is (like) a fornicator." [Reported by Ahmad, Abu Dawud, an-Nasa'i and at-Tirmidhi; the latter graded it Sahih (authentic), as did Ibn Hibban].

2112330.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112330
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 027
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 027
2112330.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "A man must not join together (in marriage to him) a woman and her paternal aunt or a woman and her maternal aunt." [Agreed upon].

2112340.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112340
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 028
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 028
2112340.text: Narrated 'Uthman (RA): Allah's Messneger (ﷺ) said: "One who is in Ihram may not marry, or be given in marriage." [Reported by Muslim]. In another narration by him it says: "He should not ask someone's hand in marriage."

2112350.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112350
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 029
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 029
2112350.text: Ibn Hibban added: "nor give someone in engagement (to be married)."

2112360.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112360
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 030
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 030
2112360.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) married Maimunah (RA) when he was in the state of Ihram (during pilgrimage). [Agreed upon].

2112370.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112370
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 031
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 031
2112370.text: Muslim reported from Maimunah (RA) herself: "The Prophet (ﷺ) married her when he was not in the state of Ihram."

2112380.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112380
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 032
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 032
2112380.text: Narrated 'Uqbah bin 'Aamir (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The most worthy conditions to be fulfilled are those by which you make sexual intercourse lawful for yourselves (in marriage)." [Agreed upon].

2112390.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112390
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 033
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 033
2112390.text: Narrated Salamah bin al-Akwa' (RA): In the year of Autas, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) permitted Mut'a (temporary marriage) for three nights, then he prohibited (afterwards). [Reported by Muslim].

2112400.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112400
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 034
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 034
2112400.text: Narrated 'Ali (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade Mut'a (temporary marriage) in the year of Khaibar. [Agreed upon].

2112410.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112410
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 035
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 035
2112410.text: Narrated Ibn Mas'ud (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) cursed the man who made a woman lawful for her first husband and the one for whom she was made lawful (the men involved in Halalah). [Reported by Ahmad, an-Nasa'i and at-Tirmidhi; the latter declared it to be Sahih (authentic)].

2112420.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112420
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 036
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 036
2112420.text: al-Arba'a except an-Nasa'i reported something related to this matter, on the authority of 'Ali (RA).

2112430.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112430
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 037
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 037
2112430.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "A man guilty of fornication, who has been flogged (for it), should not marry any but a woman like him (similarly guilty)." [Reported by Ahmad and Abu Dawud, and its narrators are reliable (thiqah)].

2112440.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112440
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 038
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 038
2112440.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): A man divorced his wife by three pronouncements and another man married her and divorced her before cohabiting with her. Then, her first husband intended to remarry her and asked Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) about that. He said, "No, until the other one (second husband) has enjoyed sexual intercourse with her as the first (husband) had." [Agreed upon; the wording is Muslim's].

2112450.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112450
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 039
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 039
2112450.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The Arabs are equal to one another and the Mawali (Non-Arabs, and originally former slaves) are equal to one another, except a weaver or a cupper." [Reported by al-Hakim, but there is a nameless narrator in its chain of narration; Abu Hatim graded it Munkar (rejected)].

2112460.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112460
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 040
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 040
2112460.text: It has a supporting narration reported by al-Bazzar from Mu'adh bin Jabal with a Munqati' (broken) chain.

2112470.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112470
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 041
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 041
2112470.text: Narrated Fatimah (RA), the daughter of Qais: The Prophet (ﷺ) told her, "Marry Usamah." [Reported by Muslim].

2112480.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112480
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 042
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 042
2112480.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "O Sons of Bayada', marry to Abu Hind (someone of your women) and marry from his women (i.e. his daughters), (even though) he was a cupper. [Abu Dawud and al-Hakim reported it with a Jayyid (good) chain of narrators].

2112490.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112490
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 043
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 043
2112490.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Barirah was given her choice regarding her husband (to remain with him or separate) when she was freed. [Agreed upon; it is a part of a long Hadith].

2112500.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112500
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 044
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 044
2112500.text: Muslim has from 'Aishah (RA): "Her husband was a slave."

2112510.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112510
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 045
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 045
2112510.text: Another narration from her has: "He was a free man." The first (narration) is more well established.

2112520.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112520
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 046
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 046
2112520.text: It has been authentically reported from Ibn 'Abbas (RA) by al-Bukhari: "...that he was a slave".

2112530.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112530
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 047
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 047
2112530.text: Narrated ad-Dahhak bin Fairuz ad-Dailami on the authority on the authority of his father (RA): I said, "O Allah's Messenger, I have accepted Islam and I am married to two sisters." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)then said, "Divorce whichever of them you wish." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a, except an-Nasa'i. Ibn Hibban, ad-Daraqutni and al-Baihaqi graded it Sahih (authentic) but al-Bukhari considered it defective].

2112540.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112540
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 048
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 048
2112540.text: Narrated Salim on the authority if his father: Ghailan bin Salamah accepted Islam and he had ten wives who accepted Islam along with him. So, the Prophet (ﷺ) commanded him to, "Choose four of them." [Reported by Ahmad and at-Tirmidhi. Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic); but al-Bukhari, Abu Zur'ah and Abu Hatim considered it defective].

2112550.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112550
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 049
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 049
2112550.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) returned his daughter Zainab (RA) to [her husband] Abul-'Aas bin ar-Rabi' (RA) based upon the first marriage, after six years (of separation), and he did not perform a new marriage. [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a except an-Nasa'i. Ahmad and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2112560.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112560
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 050
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 050
2112560.text: Narrated 'Amr bin Shu'aib on his father's authority from his grandfather: The Prophet (ﷺ) returned his daughter Zainab (RA) to [her husband] Abul-'Aas (RA) by a new marriage. [at-Tirmidhi said, "The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas (RA) is better than 'Amr's Hadith in consideration of the chains of narrators. However, that which is being observed in practice is 'Amr bin Shu'aib's Hadith"].

2112570.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112570
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 051
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 051
2112570.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): A woman had accepted Islam and then re-married, so her (previous) husband came and said, "O Allah's Messenger, I had accepted Islam and she knew that I had done so." So Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) took her away from her second husband and returned her to her first one. [Reported by Ahmad, Abu Dawud and Ibn Majah. Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2112580.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112580
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 052
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 052
2112580.text: Narrated Zaid bin Ka'b bin 'Ujrah (RA) on his father's authority: 'Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) married al-'Aaliyah of Banu Ghifar. When she entered in his presence and he removed her clothes, he saw whiteness (of leprosy) around her waist area and the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Put on your clothes and return to your family." He ordered her dowry to be given to her. [Reported by al-Hakim]. In its chain of narrators, is Jamil bin Zaid, who is Majhul (an unaccredited narrator). There is also a great difference of opinion as to who was his Shaykh.

2112590.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112590
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 053
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 053
2112590.text: Narrated Sa'id bin al-Musaiyab: 'Umar bin al-Khattab (RA) said: "If any man married a woman and after sleeping with her finds that she is affected with leprosy or insane, she gets her dowry (if he divorces her) for having intercourse with her, and it is returned to him from the one who has deceived him with her." [Sa'id bin Mansur, Malik and Ibn Abu Shaibah reported it. It's narrated are reliable (thiqah)].

2112600.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112600
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 054
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 054
2112600.text: Sa'id (bin Mansur) also reported something similar from 'Ali (RA) and added: "And (if) she has something like a horn (Qarn) (coming out of her vagina), her husband then has the right to divorce her or keep her. And if he had intercourse with her, she gets her dowry for the intercourse her husband has had."

2112610.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112610
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 055
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 055
2112610.text: Narrated Sa'id bin al-Musaiyab this Hadith also: 'Umar (RA) gave a decree regarding a husband who is impotent that he must be given delay for one year. [Its narrators are reliable].

2112620.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112620
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 056
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 056
2112620.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "He who has intercourse with a woman through her anus is accursed." [Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i reported it and the wording is his (an-Nasa'i). Its narrators are reliable, but it was considered to be defective for being Mursal (a missing link after the Tabi'i)].

2112630.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112630
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 057
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 057
2112630.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Allah will not look at a man who has intercourse with a man or a woman through the anus." [Reported by at-Tirmidhi, an-Nasa'i and Ibn Hibban, but it was considered to be defective for being Mawquf (saying of a Companion, i.e. Ibn 'Abbas)].

2112640.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112640
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 058
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 058
2112640.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "He who believes in Allah and the last Day should not harm his neighbor; and take my advice regarding good treatment of women, for they were created from a rib. And indeed the most crooked part of the rib is its upper part. If you attempt to straighten it, you will break it, and if you leave it alone it will remain crooked. So, take my advice regarding good treatment of women." [Agreed upon; the wording is al-Bukhari's].

2112650.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112650
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 059
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 059
2112650.text: Muslim has: "So if you enjoy her you will do so while crookedness remains in her; but if you attempt to straighten her you will break her, and breaking her is divorcing her."

2112660.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112660
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 060
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 060
2112660.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): We were with the Prophet (ﷺ) on an expedition. Then, when we arrived at al-Madinah and were about to enter he said, "Wait so that you may enter by night - i.e. in the evening in order that the woman with disheveled hair may comb it and the woman whose husband has been away may shave her pubic hairs (getting ready for her husband)." [Agreed upon].

2112670.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112670
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 061
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 061
2112670.text: A narration by al-Bukhari has: "When one of you has been away from home for a long time, he must not come to his family during the night."

2112680.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112680
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 062
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 062
2112680.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The worst of people in position before Allah on the Day of Resurrection is the man who has intercourse with his wife, and she with him, and then spreads her secrets." [Reported by Muslim].

2112690.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112690
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 063
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 063
2112690.text: Narrated Hakim bin Mu'awiyah on the authority of his father (RA): I asked, "O Messenger of Allah, what are the rights of a wife of one of us on her husband?" He replied, "You should give her food when you eat, clothe her when you clothe yourself, not strike her on the face, and do not revile her or desert her except within the house." [Reported by Ahmad, Abu Dawud, an-Nasa'i and Ibn Majah, al-Bukhari mentioned part of it [the last sentence] as Mu'allaq (a broken chain from the side of the collector, i.e. al-Bukhari), Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2112700.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112700
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 064
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 064
2112700.text: Narrated Jabir bin 'Abdullah (RA): The Jews used to say, "When a man has intercourse with his wife through the vagina, but from her back side, the child will be squint-eyed." Then, the Verse came down: "Your wives are a tilth to you, so come to your tilth however you wish [2:223]." [Agreed upon; the wording is Muslim's].

2112710.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112710
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 065
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 065
2112710.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If anyone who intends to have intercourse with his wife says, 'In the Name of Allah. O Allah, keep us away from the devil and keep the devil away from what You have provided us (of children)', should it be ordained that a child be born to them thereby, Satan will never harm it." [Agreed upon].

2112720.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112720
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 066
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 066
2112720.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "When a man calls his wife to come to his bed (for marital relations), and she refuses to come, and he spends the night in anger, the angels curse her till the morning." [Agreed upon; the wording is al-Bukhari's].

2112730.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112730
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 067
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 067
2112730.text: Muslim has: "He Who is in heaven is displeased with her till her husband is pleased with her."

2112740.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112740
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 068
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 068
2112740.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): "The Prophet (ﷺ) cursed the woman who joins false hair to her real hair [extensions] and the one who asks for it to be done to her; and the woman who tattoos (others) and the one who has it done (for her). [Agreed upon].

2112750.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112750
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 069
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 069
2112750.text: Narrated Judamah (RA) daughter of Wahb: I was with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) along with some people when he was saying, "I have intended to prohibit Ghila (sexual intercourse with a woman who is breast-feeding), but I considered the Romans and the Persians and saw that they engaged in Ghila without any injury being caused to their children thereby." Then they asked him about 'Azl (withdrawing the penis before emission of semen, to avoid conception), and Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) replied, "That is the secret (way of) burying alive." [Reported by Muslim]

2112770.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112770
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 070
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 070
2112770.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA): A man said, "O Allah's Messenger, I have a slave-girl and I withdraw the penis while having intercourse with her ('Azl). I dislike that she become pregnant, but I want (from her) what a man wants (from a woman). And the Jews say - withdrawing the penis to avoid conception is the minor (form of) burying alive." He replied, "The Jews told a lie, for if Allah intended to create it you would not be able to turn it away." [Reported by Ahmad and Abu Dawud, the wording is Abu Dawud's. an-Nasa'i and at-Tahawi also reported it. Its narrators are reliable].

2112780.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112780
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 071
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 071
2112780.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): In the lifetime of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) when the Qur'an was being revealed, we used to engage in 'Azl. Hence, if it had been something forbidden, the Qur'an would have forbade us from doing it. [Agreed upon].

2112790.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112790
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 072
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 072
2112790.text: And Muslim has: "That (which we were doing) reached the Prophet (ﷺ) and he did not forbid us from doing it."

2112800.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112800
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 073
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 073
2112800.text: Narrated Anas bin Malik (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) used to have intercourse with his wives (one after another), with a single bathing. [Agreed upon. The wording is Muslim's].

2112810.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112810
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 074
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 074
2112810.text: Narrated Anas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) set Safiyah (RA) free, and made her freedom her dowry. [Agreed upon].

2112820.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112820
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 075
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 075
2112820.text: Narrated Abu Salamah bin 'Abdur-Rahman (RA): I asked 'Aishah (RA), "How much had Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) given as dowry?" She replied, "His dowry to his wives was twelve Uqiya and Nashsh." She asked, "Do you know what a an-Nashsh is?" I replied, "No." She said, "It is half an Uqiya. Hence, the total was five hundred Dirhams, and that was Allah's Messenger's (ﷺ) dowry to his wives." [Reported by Muslim].

2112830.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112830
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 076
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 076
2112830.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): When 'Ali (RA) married Fatimah (RA) Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to him, "Give her something (as dowry)." He replied, "I have nothing." He said, "Where is your Hutamiya coat of mail?" [Reported by Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i; al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2112840.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112840
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 077
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 077
2112840.text: Narrated 'Amr bin Shu'aib on his father's authority from his grandfather: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If any woman marries for a dowry, a gift, or a promise before contracting the marriage, it belongs to her. As for whatever is fixed to her after contracting the marriage, it belongs to whomever it has been given. The most worthy gift a man is honored with is what he gets on account of (the marriage of) his daughter or sister." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a except at-Tirmidhi].

2112850.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112850
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 078
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 078
2112850.text: Narrated 'Alqamah on the authority of Ibn Mas'ud (RA): He was asked about a man who had married a woman and had not fixed a dowry for her. And he did not consummate (the marriage) with her till he died. Ibn Mas'ud replied, "She should receive a dowry similar to what the women of her community receive without decrease or increase. She must observe the 'Iddah period (of waiting before re-marrying and is entitled to a share of the inheritance." Ma'qil bin Sinan al-Ashja'i then got up and said, "Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ruled the same as your ruling regarding Birwa', daughter of Washiq, a woman of our tribe." Ibn Mas'ud was delighted with it. [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a. at-Tirmidhi graded it Sahih (authentic), while a group (of Hadith scholars) graded it Hasan (good)]. Narrated Jabir bin 'Abdullah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "If anyone gives as a dowry to a woman some flour or dates, he has made her lawful for himself." [Abu Dawud reported it, and indicated that the stronger opinion is that it is Mawquf (saying of a Companion)].

2112860.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112860
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 079
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 079
2112860.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin 'Aamir bin Rabi'ah on the authority of his father: The Prophet (ﷺ) gave his approval of the marriage of a woman for two sandals as a dowry. [at-Tirmidhi reported it and graded it Sahih (authentic), but he was opposed in that (grading of the Hadith)].

2112870.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112870
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 080
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 080
2112870.text: Narrated Sahl bin Sa' (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) married a man to a woman for a dowry of an iron ring. [al-Hakim reported it].

2112880.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112880
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 081
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 081
2112880.text: It is a portion of the long Hadith preceding in the beginning of the Book of Marriage.

2112890.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112890
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 082
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 082
2112890.text: Narrated 'Ali (RA): The dowry should not be less than ten Dirhams. [ad-Daraqutni reported it as Mawquf (saying of a Companion, i.e. 'Ali). Also, its chain of narrators is questionable].

2112900.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112900
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 083
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 083
2112900.text: Narrated 'Uqbah bin 'Aamir (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The best dowry is that which is most easy." [Abu Dawud reported it and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2112910.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112910
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 084
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 084
2112910.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): 'Amrah (RA) daughter al-Jaun sought refuge (in Allah) from Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) when she was brought in to him - meaning when he married her - and he said, "You have sought refuge in the One Worthy of seeking refuge in." Then he divorced her, and commanded Usama who gave her three garments as a gift (i.e. dowry). [Ibn Majah reported it, but there is a rejected narrator in its chain of narrators].

2112920.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112920
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 085
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 085
2112920.text: The origin of the aforesaid story is found in the Sahih of al-Bukhari from Abu Usaid as-Sa'idi's Hadith.

2112930.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112930
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 086
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 086
2112930.text: Narrated Anas bin Malik (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) saw the trace of yellow color on 'Abdur-Rahman bin 'Auf (RA) and asked, "What is this?" He replied, "O Messenger of Allah, I have married a woman for a Nawat weight (equal to one weight of a date-stone) of gold." He said. "May Allah bless you! Hold a wedding feast, even if with a sheep (only)." [Agreed upon; the wording is Muslim's].

2112940.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112940
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 087
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 087
2112940.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When one of you is invited to a wedding feast he must attend it." [Agreed upon].

2112950.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112950
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 088
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 088
2112950.text: Muslims has: "When one of you invites his brother, he must respond (i.e. attend), whether it is a wedding or something similar."

2112960.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112960
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 089
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 089
2112960.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The worst kind of food is that at a wedding feast from which those who come (i.e. the poor) are turned away, and to which those who refuse (i.e. the rich) are invited. If anyone does not accept an invitation he has disobeyed Allah and His Messenger." [Reported by Muslim].

2112970.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112970
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 090
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 090
2112970.text: Narrated [Abu Hurairah (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), "When one of you is invited (to a meal) he must accept. If he is fasting he should pray (i.e. make supplication for the host) and if he is not fasting he should eat." [Muslim reported it too].

2112980.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112980
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 091
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 091
2112980.text: Muslim has something similar to the above from the Hadith of Jabir (RA), it goes: "If he wishes he may eat, and if he wishes he may leave (the food alone)."

2112990.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2112990
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 092
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 092
2112990.text: Narrated Ibn Mas'ud (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The food of Walima on the first day is a duty, that on the second day is a Sunnah, while the third is showing off. Whoever (does something) to show-off, Allah will expose him (in the Hereafter)." [Reported by at-Tirmidhi who considered it Gharib (transmitted through a single narrator)]. [It is incorrectly claimed that] its narrators are those who are reported from in the Sahih (collection of al-Bukhari)].

2113000.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113000
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 093
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 093
2113000.text: This Hadith also has a supporting narration collected by Ibn Majah on the authority of Anas (RA).

2113010.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113010
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 094
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 094
2113010.text: Narrated Safiya (RA), daughter of Shaiba: The Prophet (ﷺ) held a wedding feast for one of his wives with two Mudd of barley. [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2113020.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113020
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 095
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 095
2113020.text: Narrated Anas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) stayed three nights between Khaibar and al-Madinah when he consummated his marriage with Safiya (RA). I called the Muslims to his wedding feast which did not include bread or meat. He just ordered some leather dining sheets to be spread, and [Hais, a food made from] dates, sun-baked yogurt and butter were thrown on them. [Agreed upon: the wording is al-Bukhari's].

2113030.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113030
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 096
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 096
2113030.text: Narrated a Companion of the Prophet (ﷺ): "When two people come together to issue an invitation, accept that of the one whose door is nearer to you. However, if one of them comes before the other, accept the invitation of the first." [Reported by Abu Dawud, its chain of narrators is weak].

2113040.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113040
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 097
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 097
2113040.text: Narrated Abu Juhaifah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "I do not eat Muttaki'an (sitting with support of something, so as to eat more)." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2113050.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113050
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 098
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 098
2113050.text: Narrated 'Umar bin Abu Salamah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to me, "Dear child, mention Allah's Name, eat with your right hand, and eat from what is next to you." [Agreed upon].

2113060.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113060
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 099
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 099
2113060.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) was brought a dish containing Tharid and said, "Eat from its side and not from the middle, for the blessing descends in the middle of it." [Reported by al-Arba'a. This is the wording of an-Nasa'i. Its chain of narrators is Sahih (authentic)].

2113070.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113070
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 100
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 100
2113070.text: Abu Huraira reported that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) never found fault with food (served to him). If he liked anything, he ate it and if he did not like it he left it. [Agreed upon]

2113080.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113080
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 101
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 101
2113080.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Do not eat with the left hand, for the devil eats with the left hand." [Reported by Muslim].

2113090.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113090
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 102
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 102
2113090.text: Narrated Abu Qatadah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "When one of you drinks, he must not breathe into the vessel." [Agreed upon].

2113100.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113100
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 103
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 103
2113100.text: Abu Dawud reported something similar from Ibn 'Abbas (RA) and he added: "or blow into it," [at-Tirmidhi graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2113110.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113110
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 104
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 104
2113110.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to divide visits to his wives equally and say, "O Allah, this is my division concerning what I possess, so do not blame me concerning what You possess and I do not." [Reported by al-Arba'a; Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic). at-Tirmidhi held that the stronger view is that it is Mursal (a missing link in the chain after the Tabi'i)].

2113120.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113120
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 105
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 105
2113120.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Anyone who has two wives and inclines to one of them will come on the Day of Resurrection with a side (of his body) inclining." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a; its chain of narrators is Sahih (authentic)].

2113130.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113130
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 106
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 106
2113130.text: Narrated Anas (RA): It is from the Sunnah that when a man who has a wife marries a virgin, he should spend with her seven nights, and thereafter divide time between them (equally). And if he marries a formerly married woman he should spend with her three nights and thereafter divide the time between his wives (equally). [Agreed upon: the wording is al-Bukhari's].

2113140.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113140
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 107
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 107
2113140.text: Narrated Umm Salamah (RA): When the Prophet (ﷺ) married her he stayed with her for three nights and said, "You are not being humbles in my estimation. If you wish I shall stay with you seven nights, and if I stay with you for seven nights I shall do the same with my other wives." [Reported by Muslim].

2113150.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113150
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 108
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 108
2113150.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Sauda (RA) daughter of Zam'ah gave away her day to 'Aishah (RA). So the Prophet (ﷺ) allotted a share to 'Aishah (RA) of her day and Sauda's. [Agreed upon].

2113160.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113160
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 109
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 109
2113160.text: Narrated 'Urwah (RA): 'Aishah (RA) said: "O my nephew, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) would not prefer some of us over others regarding the division of the time he would spend with us. It was very rare that he would not visit us all, and come near each of his wives without having intercourse with her, till he reached the one whose day it was, and spent the night with her." [Reported by Ahmad and Abu Dawud, the wording is Abu Dawud's. al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2113170.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113170
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 110
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 110
2113170.text: Muslim reported 'Aishah (RA) as saying: "When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) offered the 'Asr (afternoon) prayer, he would visit his wives in turn, then come close to them (kiss or hug them)." [The narrator reported the rest of the Hadith previous].

2113180.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113180
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 111
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 111
2113180.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): During the illness of which Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) died, he was asking, "Where shall I be tomorrow?" He desired that it would be 'Aishah's day. His wives therefore permitted him to stay where he wished, and he stayed in 'Aishah's house. [Agreed upon].

2113190.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113190
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 112
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 112
2113190.text: Narrated ['Aishah (RA)]: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) intended to go on a journey, he cast lots among his wives. Then, he would take with him the one who was chosen by the lot. [Agreed upon].

2113200.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113200
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 113
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 113
2113200.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin Zam'ah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "None of you should whip his wife like the whipping of a slave." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2113210.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113210
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 114
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 114
2113210.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): The wife of Thabit bin Qais came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and said, "O Allah's Messenger, I do not find fault with Thabit bin Qais (RA) in respect of character or religion, but I dislike (and fear) that I might commit an act of Kufr fil-Islam (that which is contradictory to Islamic behavior)." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) asked her, "Will you give him back his garden?" And she replied, "Yes," so Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to him, "Accept the garden and divorce her, with one pronouncement (of divorce)." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2113220.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113220
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 115
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 115
2113220.text: Another narration by him has: "He commanded him to divorce her."

2113230.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113230
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 116
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 116
2113230.text: Abu Dawud and at-Tirmidhi reported this Hadith and the later graded it Hasan (good): "The wife of Thabit bin Qais got a divorce from him in return for a compensation (paid by her), and the Prophet (ﷺ) made her 'Iddah (period of waiting before re-marrying) one menstruation course."

2113240.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113240
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 117
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 117
2113240.text: Ibn Majah reported the narration of 'Amr bin Shu'aib, on this father's authority, from his grandfather: "Thabit bin Qais was very unattractive and his wife said, 'Were it not for the fear of Allah, when he entered my presence I would spit in his face.'"

2113250.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113250
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 118
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 118
2113250.text: Ahmad reported from Sahl bin Abu Hathma's Hadith that it was the first ever husband and wife separation for compensation in Islam.

2113260.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113260
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 119
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 119
2113260.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The lawful thing which Allah hates most is divorce." [Reported by Abu Dawud and Ibn Majah, al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic), while Abu Hatim held the stronger view is that it is Mursal (missing link after the Tabi'i)].

2113270.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113270
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 120
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 120
2113270.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): In the time of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), he divorced his wife while she was menstruating, so 'Umar asked Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) about that and he replied, "Command him to take her back and keep her till she is purified (from menses), has another period, and is then purified. If he then wishes he may keep her and if he wishes he may divorce her before having intercourse with her. That is the 'Iddah (period of waiting) which Allah commanded for the divorce of women." [Agreed upon].

2113280.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113280
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 121
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 121
2113280.text: A narration by Muslim has: "Command him to take her back, then divorce her when she is pure from the menstrual discharge, or pregnant."

2113290.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113290
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 122
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 122
2113290.text: Another narration by al-Bukhari has: "It was regarded as one divorce."

2113300.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113300
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 123
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 123
2113300.text: A narration of Muslim has: "Ibn 'Umar (RA) said: 'If you had only made one or two pronouncements of divorce [it would have been better]. Indeed Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) commanded me to take her back, then keep her till she has another period, then give her a reprieve till she is purified, then divorce her before having intercourse with her. As for you, you have divorced her with three pronouncements (at once), and have therefore disobeyed your Rabb (your Lord, the Creator) concerning what He commanded you regarding divorcing your wife.'"

2113310.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113310
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 124
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 124
2113310.text: Another narration [of Muslim] has: "Abdullah bin 'Umar (RA) said: 'So he returned her to me and did not regarded it as anything, and said: When she is purified, either divorce her or keep her.'"

2113320.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113320
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 125
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 125
2113320.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): In the time of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), Abu Bakr (RA) and the first two years of the caliphate of 'Umar (RA), the three pronouncements of divorce were regarded as one divorce. So 'Umar said, "People have made haste in an affair which they are required to take slowly. What if we execute it on them." So, he executed it on them. [Reported by Muslim].

2113330.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113330
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 126
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 126
2113330.text: Narrated Mahmud bin Labid (RA): WHen Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was informed about a man who had divorced his wife with all three pronouncements (without any interval between them), he stood up in anger and said, 'Is Allah's Book being played with while I am among you?" As a result a man got up and said, "O Allah's Messenger, shall I kill him?" [Reported by an-Nasa'i; its narrators are reliable (thiqah)].

2113340.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113340
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 127
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 127
2113340.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Abu Rukana divorced Umm Rukana. So Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) told him, "Take your wife back." And he replied, "I have divorced her with three pronouncements." He said, "I have understood, take her back." [Reported by Abu Dawud].

2113350.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113350
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 128
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 128
2113350.text: A wording by Ahmad has: Abu Rukana divorced his wife with three pronouncements, in one sitting. Then, he was grieved about her and Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) told him, "They (the three pronouncements) are reckoned as a single (utterance of divorce)." [The two Ahadith have Ibn Ishaq, in their chains of narrators, and his reliability has been questioned].

2113360.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113360
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 129
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 129
2113360.text: Abu Dawud has reported (a Hadith) better than the aforesaid one through another chain, it has: "Abu Rukana divorced his wife Suhaimah irrevocably and said, 'I swear by Allah that I meant it to be only a single utterance of divorce,' so the Prophet (ﷺ) returned her to him."

2113370.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113370
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 130
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 130
2113370.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "There are three things which, whether undertaken seriously or in jest, are treated as serious: marriage, divorce and taking back a wife after a divorce which is not final." [Reported by al-Arba'a except an-Nasa'i. al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2113380.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113380
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 131
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 131
2113380.text: In a narration of Ibn 'Adi, through another chain of narrators, which is Da'if (weak); it has: "Divorce, emancipation and marriage."

2113390.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113390
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 132
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 132
2113390.text: al-Harith bin Abu Usamah reported from the Hadith of 'Ubadah bin as-Samit [RA) - tracing it to the Prophet (ﷺ): "It is not permissible to play in three things: divorce, marriage and emancipation. Therefore, whoever pronounce (either of) them, they certainly become binding." [Its chain of narrators is Da'if (weak)].

2113400.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113400
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 133
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 133
2113400.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Allah, the Most High, has forgiven my followers what they contemplate on within themselves (i.e. evil thoughts) as long as they do not act upon or speak about them." [Agreed upon].

2113410.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113410
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 134
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 134
2113410.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ)) said: "Allah, the Most High, has overlooked my follower's mistakes and forgetfulness, and what they are forced to do against their will." [Reported by Ibn Majah and al-Hakim. Abu Hatim said that it is not an established (authentic) Hadith].

2113420.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113420
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 135
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 135
2113420.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): "If anyone makes his wife unlawful for himself - it is nothing." He said, "Indeed you have a good example in Allah's Messenger." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2113430.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113430
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 136
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 136
2113430.text: Muslim has: "When a man makes his wife unlawful for himself, it is (treated like) an oath for which atonement must be made (if broken)."

2113440.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113440
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 137
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 137
2113440.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): When the daughter of al-Jaun was admitted into the presence of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and he went near her, she said, "I seek refuge in Allah from you." He replied, "You have sought refuge in the Supreme [One Who is worthy of refuge being taken in], return to your family." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2113450.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113450
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 138
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 138
2113450.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "There is no divorce except after marriage, and no freeing (of a slave) till one has possession (of one)." [Reported by Abu Ya'la and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic), but it is Ma'lul (containing a hidden defective).

2113460.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113460
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 139
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 139
2113460.text: Ibn Majah reported a similar narration, on the authority of al-Miswar bin Makhramah, and its chain of narrators is (or appears to be) Hasan (good), but it is also Ma'lul (hidden defect)].

2113470.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113470
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 140
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 140
2113470.text: Narrated 'Amr bin Shu'aib on his father's authority from his grandfather: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "No descendant of Adam may make a vow concerning something he does not possess, or set free (a slave) that he does not possess, or divorce (a woman) whom he does not possess (in marriage)." [Abu Dawud and at-Tirmidhi reported it; the latter graded it Sahih (authentic), and transmitted from al-Bukhari his statement that it is the most authentic Hadith on this subject].

2113490.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113490
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 141
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 141
2113490.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "There are three people whose actions are not recorded, a sleeping person till he awakes, a child till he is a grown up, and an insane person till he is restored to reason or recovers his sense." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a, except at-Tirmidhi. al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2113500.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113500
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 142
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 142
2113500.text: Narrated 'Imran bin Husain (RA): He was asked about a man who divorces his wife, then takes her back without taking witnesses (on either). So he replied, "Get witnesses on her divorce, and on her return." [Abu Dawud reported it Mawquf (saying of a Companion), and its chain of narrators is Sahih (authentic)].

2113510.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113510
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 143
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 143
2113510.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): When he divorced his wife the Prophet (ﷺ) said to 'Umar, "Command him to take her back." [Agreed upon].

2113520.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113520
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 144
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 144
2113520.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) swore that he would stay away from his wives for a period. He made something unlawful (for himself) (i.e. something not in itself unlawful). So, he made the lawful unlawful, and he made atonement for breaking an oath. [Reported by at-Tirmidhi, and its narrators are reliable (thiqah)].

2113530.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113530
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 145
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 145
2113530.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): When a period of four months elapses, the one who swears to stay away from his wife must be made to return to her or divorce her, and the divorce is not valid till the husband himself pronounces it. [al-Bukhari reported it].

2113540.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113540
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 146
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 146
2113540.text: Narrated Sulaiman bin Yasar (RA): I met thirteen or more of the Companions of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), all of them made the one who swears to stay away from his wife, return to her or divorce her (at the end of the period). [Reported by ash-Shafi'i].

2113550.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113550
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 147
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 147
2113550.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): The swearing to stay away from one's wife in al-Jahiliyyah era was for one or two years. Then, Allah appointed a period of four months for it. So, if it is less than four months, it is not swearing to stay away from one's wife. [al-Baihaqi reported it]

2113560.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113560
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 148
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 148
2113560.text: Narrated [Ibn 'Abbas (RA)]: A man had vowed to make his wife like his mother (i.e. forbidden for him). Then he had intercourse with her, so he went to the Prophet (ﷺ) and said, "I had intercourse with her before making the atonement." He replied, "Do not go near her till you do what Allah has commanded you to do." Reported by al-Arba'a. at-Tirmidhi graded it Sahih (authentic) but an-Nasa'i held that the stronger view is that it is Mursal (missing link after the Tabi'i)].

2113570.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113570
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 149
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 149
2113570.text: al-Bazzar reported it through another chain, from Ibn 'Abbas (RA) and he added: "Make atonement and do not repeat it."

2113580.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113580
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 150
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 150
2113580.text: Narrated Salamah bin Sakhr (RA): When the month of Ramadan came, I feared lest I would have intercourse with my wife. So, I vowed az-Zihar (the she was like my mother). Then, one night something of her was uncovered to me and I had intercourse with her. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) afterwards said to me, "Set a slave free," and I replied, "I do not possess one (that I can free)." He said, "Then fast two consecutive months." I replied, "Have I fallen into that which I have fallen into except due to fasting!?" He said, "Feed sixty poor people with an 'Araq (basket) of dates." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a except an-Nasa'i. Ibn Khuzaimah and Ibn al-Jarud graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2113590.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113590
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 151
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 151
2113590.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): So-and-so asked and said, "O Allah's Messenger, what do you think if one of us finds his wife committing adultery, how should he act? If he talks he would talk about a grievous affair, and if he keeps silent he would keep silent about something similar (a grievous affair)." He gave no answer. Afterwards he came to him (ﷺ) and said, "I have been afflicted with the very problem which I had asked you about." Then Allah revealed the verses of Surat an-Nur (the Light). He then recited them to him and exhorted, admonished and informed him that the punishment of this world is easier than that of the Hereafter. He said, "No, by Him Who sent you with the Truth, I have not lied against her." He then summoned the woman and exhorted her in the same way. She said, "No, by Him Who sent you with the Truth, he is a liar." He began with the man; and he (the man) bore witness four times with an oath by Allah; he then did the same with the woman, then he separated them. [Reported by Muslim].

2113610.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113610
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 152
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 152
2113610.text: Narrated [Ibn 'Umar (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to the two who were invoking curses regarding one another, "Your reckoning is in Allah's Hands for one of you is lying. You cannot remarry her." He (the man) said: "O Allah's Messenger, what about my property (dowry)?" He replied, "If you have spoken the truth, it is the price of your having had the right of intercourse with her, and if you have lied against her, it is even more remote for you (to get it back) from her." [Agreed upon].

2113620.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113620
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 153
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 153
2113620.text: Narrated Anas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Observe her, and if she gives birth to a child which is white complexioned with dark hair, her husband would be its father. But if she gives birth to a child with eyes looking as if they have antimony (Kuhl) in them and curled hair, the man whom her husband charged her with committing adultery is its father." [Agreed upon].

2113640.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113640
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 154
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 154
2113640.text: Narrated Ibn Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ordered a man to put his hand on his mouth when he came to the fifth pronouncement and said, "It would be the deciding one." [Reported by Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i. It's narrators are reliable].

2113650.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113650
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 155
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 155
2113650.text: Narrated Sahl bin Sa'd (RA) concerning the story of the two (husband and wife) who invoked curses regarding one another: When they finished invoking curses regarding one another the man said, "I shall have lied against her, O Allah's Messenger, if I keep her (as a wife)." He, then, pronounced her divorce three times, even before Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) commanded him to do so. [Agreed upon].

2113660.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113660
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 156
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 156
2113660.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (ﷺ): A man came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and said, "My wife rejects no hand of a man who wished to touch her." He said, "Banish her." He replied, "I am afraid my soul may desire her." He said, "Then enjoy her." [Reported by Abu Dawud and al-Bazzar, and its narrators are reliable].

2113670.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113670
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 157
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 157
2113670.text: an-Nasa'i reported it with through another chain, from Ibn 'Abbas (RA) with this wording: He said, "Divorce her." He replied "I can not endure the desire for her." He said, "Then keep her."

2113680.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113680
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 158
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 158
2113680.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): He heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) say, when the Verse (24:6) about invoking curses came down, "Any woman who brings into a family one who does belong to it, is not an observer of Allah's (religion), and Allah will not admit her into His Paradise. Likewise, Allah will veil Himself from any man who disowns his child while he knows that is his child, and will humiliate him in the presence of the first and last (creatures)." [Abu Dawud, an-Nasa'i and Ibn Majah reported it; and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2113690.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113690
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 159
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 159
2113690.text: Narrated 'Umar (RA): If anyone acknowledges that he is the father of his child just for the blinking of an eye, he has no right to disown it." [al-Baihaqi reported it. The Hadith is Hasan (good) and Mawquf (saying of a Companion)].

2113700.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113700
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 160
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 160
2113700.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): A man said, "O Allah's Messenger, my wife has given birth to a black son." He asked, "Have you any camels?" He replied, "Yes." He asked, "What is their color?" He replied, "They are red." He asked, "Is there a dusky (dark) one among them?" He replied, "Yes." He asked, "How has that come about?" He replied, "It is perhaps a strain to which it has reverted (i.e. heredity)." He said, "It is perhaps a strain to which this son of yours has reverted." [Agreed upon].

2113710.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113710
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 161
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 161
2113710.text: Muslim concluded the Hadith as follows: "He did not permit him to disown him"

2113720.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113720
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 162
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 162
2113720.text: Narrated al-Miswar bin Makhramah (RA): Some nights after her husband's death, Subai'ah al-Aslamiyah (RA) gave birth to a child. Then she went to the Prophet (ﷺ) and asked permission to marry. He gave her permission and she married. [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2113730.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113730
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 163
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 163
2113730.text: Its basic meaning is found in the two Sahih books of al-Bukhari and Muslim.

2113740.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113740
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 164
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 164
2113740.text: A wording has: "She gave birth to a child after forty nights of her husband's death."

2113750.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113750
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 165
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 165
2113750.text: A wording by Muslim has: az-Zuhri said, "I think there is no harm if she marries when she is still bleeding (due to child-birth), but her husband should not go near her till she is purified."

2113760.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113760
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 166
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 166
2113760.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Barirah was ordered to wait till three menstrual periods of hers have passed (before she could remarry). [Reported by Ibn Majah. Its narrators are reliable, but it is Ma'lul (having a hidden defect)].

2113770.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113770
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 167
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 167
2113770.text: Narrated ash-Sha'bi from Fatimah (RA) daughter of Qais on the authority of the Prophet (ﷺ) regarding a woman who was divorced by three pronouncements: "She has no right to accommodation or maintenance." [Reported by Muslim].

2113780.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113780
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 168
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 168
2113780.text: Narrated Umm 'Atiyah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "A woman must not observe her mourning for more than three nights for the one who has died, except for the four months and ten days in the case of her husband; and she must not wear a dyed garment except one of the type made of 'Ash (dyed yarn) or apply Kuhl (antimony), or apply perfume, except for a little Qust or Azfar, when she has been purified after her menstruation." [Agreed upon. The wording being of Muslim].

2113790.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113790
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 169
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 169
2113790.text: Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i have an addition: "nor be dyed (with Henna and the like)."

2113800.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113800
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 170
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 170

2113810.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113810
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 171
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 171
2113810.text: Narrated Umm Salamah (RA): I put Sabir (a type of medicine) on my eyes after Abu Salamah (RA) had died. So Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "It gives the face a glow, so apply it only at night and remove it in the day time, and do not comb (your hair) with scent or henna, for it is a dye." I asked, "What should I use when combing (my hair)?" He replied, "You should use lote-tree leaves." [Reported by Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i: its chain of narrators is Hasan (good)].

2113820.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113820
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 172
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 172
2113820.text: Narrated [Umm Salamah (RA)]: A woman said: "O Allah's Messenger, my daughter's husband died and her eye is troubling her, so may we apply Kuhl (antimony) to it?" He replied, "No." [Agreed upon].

2113830.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113830
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 173
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 173
2113830.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): My maternal aunt was divorced and wanted to cut down fruit from her paml-trees. A man forbade her to go out, so she went to the Prophet (ﷺ) and he said, "Certainly, cut down fruit from your palm-trees, for perhaps you have give Sadaqah (charity) or do an act of kindness." [Reported by Muslim]. 1121. Narrated Furai'ah, daughter of Malik: Her husband had gone out in search of some slaves of his and they killed him. She said, "I asked Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) to be allowed to return to my family, for my husband had not left for me a house which belonged to him, nor had he left me maintenance." He then said, "Yes, (I agree)," but when I was in the courtyard, he called me and said, "Stay in your house till the prescribed period expires." She said, "I observed the period in it for four months and ten days." She said, "Afterwards 'Uthman gave judgements in accordance with that." [Ahmad an al-Arba'a reported it. at-Tirmidhi, adh-Dhuhli, Ibn Hibban, al-Hakim and others graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2113840.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113840
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 174
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 174
2113840.text: Narrated Fatimah (RA) daughter of Qais: I said, "O Allah's Messenger, my husband has divorced me by three pronouncements (of divorce) and I am afraid that I may get broken into. Hence, he commanded her, and she moved (to another house)." [Reported by Muslim].

2113850.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113850
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 175
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 175
2113850.text: Narrated 'Amr bin al-'Aas (RA): "Do not confuse us about our Prophet's Sunnah: The period that a slave-woman, whose master dies, and she has begotten a child from him must wait for, is four months and ten days." [Reported by Ahmad, Abu Dawud and Ibn Majah. al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic), but ad-Daraqutni considered it defective due to Inqita' (broken link)].

2113860.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113860
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 176
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 176
2113860.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): al-Aqra' is the period of a woman's purity (which occurs between two menses). [Malik, Ahmad and an-Nasa'i reported it in the course of a story with a Sahih (authentic) chain of narrators].

2113870.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113870
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 177
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 177
2113870.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): The divorce of a slave-woman occurs by saying it (the divorce word) twice, and her 'Iddah (waiting period) is two menses. [Reported by ad-Daraqutni].

2113880.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113880
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 178
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 178
2113880.text: He reported it as Marfu' (a saying of the Prophet) and graded it Da'if (weak).

2113890.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113890
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 179
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 179
2113890.text: Abu Dawud, at-Tirmidhi and Ibn Majah reported the aforesaid Hadith from the narration of 'Aishah (RA), which al-Hakim graded as Sahih (authentic), but the Hadith scholars disagreed with him, and they agreed that it is Da'if (weak).

2113900.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113900
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 180
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 180
