2113900.text: Narrated Ruwaifi' bin Thabit (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "It is not lawful for a man who believes in Allah and the Last Day to water what another person has sown." [Abu Dawud and at-Tirmidhi reported it. Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic), and al-Bazzar graded it Hasan (good)].

2113910.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113910
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 181
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 181
2113910.text: Narrated 'Umar (RA) regarding a wife of a lost husband: She should wait for four years and then observe the 'Iddah for four months and ten days (before she may remarry). [Malik and ash-Shafi'i reported it].

2113920.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113920
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 182
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 182
2113920.text: Narrated al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The spouse of a lost husband remains his wife till she gets a certain news about his death." [ad-Daraqutni reported it with a Da'if (weak) chain of narrators].

2113930.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113930
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 183
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 183
2113930.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "A man must not spend the night in the house of woman unless he is her husband or a Mahram." [Reported by Muslim].

2113950.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113950
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 184
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 184
2113950.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "A man must not be alone with a woman except in the presence of a Mahram." [al-Bukhari reported it].

2113960.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113960
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 185
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 185
2113960.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id (RA)" The Prophet (ﷺ) said in regard to the captives taken at Autas, "There must be no intercourse with a pregnant woman till she gives birth, or with one who is not pregnant till she has had one menstrual period." [Abu Dawud reported it, and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2113970.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113970
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 186
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 186
2113970.text: The aforesaid Hadith has a supporting narration from Ibn 'Abbas (RA) reported by ad-Daraqutni.

2113980.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113980
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 187
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 187
2113980.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The child (born out of wedlock) belongs to the one on whose bed it is born, and stoning to death is for the fornicator." [Agreed upon, regarding Abu Hurairah's Hadith].

2113990.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2113990
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 188
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 188
2113990.text: The aforesaid Hadith is also a part of 'Aishah's Hadith in the course of a story.

2114000.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114000
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 189
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 189
2114000.text: And from Ibn Mas'ud by an-Nasa'i.

2114010.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114010
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 190
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 190

2114020.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114020
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 191
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 191
2114020.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "One or two sucks do not make (marriage) unlawful." [Muslim reported it].

2114030.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114030
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 192
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 192
2114030.text: Narrated ['Aishah (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Be sure (you women) who your brothers are, for suckling is that which is the result of hunger (i.e. when milk is the child's only food)." [Agreed upon].

2114040.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114040
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 193
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 193
2114040.text: Narrated ['Aishah (RA)]: Sahlah (RA) daughter of Suhail (RA) came and said, "O Allah's Messenger, Salim the manumitted slave of Abu Hudhaifah lives with us in our house; and he has attained what men attain (i.e. puberty)." He said, "Suckle him so you would become unlawful to him (in marriage)." [Reported by Muslim].

2114050.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114050
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 194
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 194
2114050.text: Narrated ['Aishah (RA)]: Aflah (her foster suckling uncle), brother of Abul-Qais, came and asked her permission to enter after the Hijab (was instituted for women). She said, "I refused to allow him in and when Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) came, I told him about what I had done, so he commanded me to give him permission to enter where I am and said, 'He is your paternal uncle.'" [Agreed upon].

2114060.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114060
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 195
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 195
2114060.text: Narrated ['Aishah (RA)]: In what was sent down in the Qur'an was 'ten known sucklings made marriage unlawful'. Afterwards, they were abrogated by 'five known ones.' Then, when Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) died these words were among what was recited in the Qur'an. [Reported by Muslim].

2114070.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114070
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 196
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 196
2114070.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) was offered to marry the daughter of Hamzah. He said, "She is unlawful to me for she is the daughter of my brother in suckling; and what is unlawful by reason of blood relationship is unlawful by reason of suckling relationship." [Agreed upon].

2114080.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114080
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 197
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 197
2114080.text: Narrated Umm Salamah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The suckling that makes marriage unlawful is that which reaches the intestines (i.e. nourishes the child), and is taken before (two years) time of weaning." [Reported by at-Tirmidhi, he and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2114090.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114090
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 198
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 198
2114090.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Suckling applies only (to infants) during the first two years (of their life). [Reported by ad-Daraqutni and Ibn 'Adi as Marfu' (a saying of the Prophet) and Mawquf (a saying of a Companion). However, they both held that the stronger view is that it is Mawquf (i.e. saying if Ibn 'Abbas).

2114100.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114100
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 199
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 199
2114100.text: Narrated Ibn Mas'ud (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The only suckling (to be considered) is that which gives life to the bones and causes flesh to grow." [Abu Dawud reported it].

2114110.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114110
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 200
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 200
2114110.text: Narrated 'Uqbah bin al-Harith: He married Umm Yahya, daughter of Abu Ihab, and a woman came and said, "I have suckled both of you." So he asked the Prophet (ﷺ) and he replied, "How (can you hesitate) while it has been said (that you are foster brothers and sisters)?" 'Uqbah therefore separated from her and she married another husband. [al-Bukhari reported it].

2114120.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114120
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 201
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 201
2114120.text: Narrated Ziyad as-Sahmi: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade that a stupid woman may be asked to suckle an infant. [Abu Dawud reported it. It is Mursal (missing link after the Tabi'i) and Ziyad is not a Sahabi].

2114130.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114130
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 202
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 202
2114130.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Hind daughter of 'Utbah - wife of Abu Sufyan - came to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and said, "O Allah's Messenger, Abu Sufyan is a miser who does not give me and my sons enough maintenance, except what I take from his wealth without his knowledge. Is there any blame on me for doing this?" He replied, "Take from his wealth what is reasonable and enough for you and your sons." [Agreed upon].

2114140.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114140
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 203
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 203
2114140.text: Narrated Tariq al-Muharibi (RA): We arrived at al-Madinah when Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was standing on the Minbar addressing the people and saying, "The hand of the giver is the upper one, and spend first on those who are dependent on you: your mother and father, your sister and brother, then your relatives in order of their closeness to you." [Reported by an-Nasa'i. Ibn Hibban and ad-Daraqutni graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2114150.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114150
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 204
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 204
2114150.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "A slave is entitled to his food and clothing, and he should be burdened except with the work that he is capable of doing." [Reported by Muslim].

2114160.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114160
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 205
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 205
2114160.text: Narrated Hakim bin Mu'awiyah al-Qushairi on his father's authority (RA): I asked, "O Allah's Messenger, what is the right of the wife of one of us upon her husband?" He replied, "That you should give her food when you eat, and clothe her when you clothe yourself, and do not strike her on the face and do not revile her." [The narrator narrated the rest of the Hadith that has been mentioned in the chapter on the treatment of wives].

2114170.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114170
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 206
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 206
2114170.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) - in the Hadith of pilgrimage which is long - said in regard to women, "They (women) have rights over you (the men) to provide them with their sustenance and clothing in a reasonable manner." [Muslim reported it].

2114180.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114180
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 207
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 207
2114180.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "It is enough for a person to be considered sinful, that he neglects those whom he is responsible to sustain." [Reported by an-Nasa'i].

2114190.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114190
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 208
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 208
2114190.text: Muslim has this wording: "...to withhold (food) from the one whose food he possesses."

2114200.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114200
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 209
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 209
2114200.text: Narrated Jabir (RA) in a Hadith which he attributed to the Prophet (ﷺ) regarding a pregnant (woman) whose husband died: "She has no maintenance rights." [al-Baihaqi reported it. Its narrators are reliable, but al-Baihaqi said, "The correct narration is that which is Mawquf (a saying of a Companion)"].

2114210.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114210
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 210
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 210
2114210.text: It was established that no maintenance is due (to a woman who was divorced with three pronouncements) in the Hadith of Fatimah (RA) daughter of Qais, which has preceded. [Reported by Muslim].

2114220.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114220
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 211
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 211
2114220.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The upper hand is better than the lower one, and one of you should spend first on those he is responsible to provide for, lest a woman would say, 'Feed me or divorce me.'" [Reported by ad-Daraqutni, and its chain of narrators is Hasan (good)].

2114230.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114230
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 212
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 212
2114230.text: Narrated Sa'id bin al-Musaiyab regarding a man who finds nothing to spend on his wife: "They are to be separated." Reported by Sa'id bin Mansur, from Sufyan, from Abu az-Zinad, from Sa'id bin al-Musaiyab. He said, "I asked Sa'id (bin al-Musaiyab), 'Is this Sunnah?' And he replied, 'Yes, it is Sunnah!'" [This Hadith is a strong Mursal (missing link after the Tabi'i].

2114240.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114240
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 213
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 213
2114240.text: Narrated 'Umar: He wrote (letters) to the commanders of the armies regarding some men (soldiers) who have been absent from their wives, that they should impose upon them to spend on their wives or divorce them; and if they divorce them they should then send the maintenance which they have withheld. [ash-Shafi'i reported it, then al-Baihaqi with a Hasan (good) chain of narrators].

2114250.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114250
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 214
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 214
2114250.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): A man came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and said, "I have a Dinar." He said, "Spend it on yourself." He said, "I have another." He replied, "Spend it on your children." He said, "I have another." He replied, "Spend it on your wife." He said, "I have another." He replied, "Spend it on your servant." He said, "I have another." He replied, "You know best (what to do with it)." [ash-Shafi'i and Abu Dawud reported it, and the wording is Abu Dawud's. an-Nasa'i and al-Hakim reported it with the wife preceding the children].

2114260.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114260
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 215
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 215
2114260.text: Narrated Bahz bin Hakim on his father's authority from his grandfather (RA): I asked, "O Allah's Messenger, to whom should I be kind and dutiful?" He replied, "Your mother." I asked, "Who comes next?" He replied, "Your mother." I asked, "Who comes next?" He replied, "Your mother." I asked, "Who comes next?" He replied, "Your father, then your relatives in order of nearness (of relationship)." [Abu Dawud and at-Tirmidhi reported it; the latter graded it Hasan (good)].

2114270.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114270
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 216
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 216
2114270.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin 'Amr (RA): A woman said, "O Allah's Messenger, this son of mine: my womb was a receptacle for him, my breasts were a source of suckling for him, and my lap was a place for him to curl up in, yet his father has divorced me and wants to take him away from me." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) replied to her, "You have more right to him as long as you do not remarry." [Reported by Ahmad and Abu Dawud. al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2114280.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114280
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 217
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 217
2114280.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): A woman said, "O Allah's Messenger, my husband wants to take away my son, while he has benefited me and provided me with drinking water from the well of Abu 'Inabah." Then her husband came and the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Young man, this is your father and this is your mother, so take whoever of them you wish by the hand." He took his mother's hand and she went off with him. [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a. at-Tirmidhi graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2114290.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114290
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 218
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 218
2114290.text: Narrated Rafi' bin Sinan (RA): He accepted Islam but his wife refused to accept it. The Prophet (ﷺ) then made the mother sit down to a side and the father to another side and made the son sit down between them. He (the son) then inclined to his mother, so the Prophet (ﷺ) then said. "O Allah, give him guidance." Then he inclined to his father and he took him. [Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i reported it. al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2114300.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114300
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 219
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 219
2114300.text: Narrated al-Bara bin 'Azib (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) gave a ruling regarding Hamza's daughter in favor of her maternal aunt, saying, "The maternal aunt is in the position of the mother." [al-Bukhari reported it].

2114310.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114310
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 220
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 220
2114310.text: Ahmad reported it from the Hadith of 'Ali (RA), he said, "The little girl must be with her maternal aunt for the maternal aunt is (the same as) a mother."

2114320.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114320
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 221
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 221
2114320.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When one's servant serves him with his food, if he does not make him sit down with him (and eat) he should give him one or two morsels (of it)." [Agreed upon, and the wording is al-Bukhari's].

2114330.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2114330
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 222
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 222
2114330.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "A woman was punished on account of a cat which she held captive till it died. Hence, she entered the Hell-Fire due to (her mistreatment of) the cat. She did not feed it or give it water while she held it captive, nor did she let it out so that it may eat the things that creep on the earth." [Agreed upon].
